TopicTitle: What Game Mode is for you?

Articles.Content:
Hey guys,

With this DevNote, and even DevNotes past, I've been hearing some heated debates about Development leaning towards career mode. I understand that Sandbox is always being updated when career mode gets updated even though Career gets more features than sandbox. But isn't that the way it should be?

Anyway, I've started 3 career games since it was introduced but my latest one is the one that I got the farthest in but I usually stop playing and start a Sandbox. I Just like the RPG pliability especially when I use Crew Manifest to give my Kerbals rank, and Final Frontier to give them Ribbons. But i still do probe incursions and would still like R&D to be open at least the Archives, and see the witty science notes when i do science.

That being said I would love to hear your take on this debate and see what you guys play the most. Thanks.

I've never played career mode.

I do wish they would turn on science reports and points for sandbox mode, however, just to add to the fun there.

Career Mode, I've always loved the whole "start small" work your way up kind of thing. Never played creative mode in Minecraft, always had to do it the old fashion way.

Of course sandbox was fun as heck when it was the only thing, but when career came out, I just liked it better.
My Career mode becomes my Sandbox mode
How do you know what Multiplayer will be?
Career just because its fun to start out with nothing and work your way up, plus squads messages in the science are pretty funny!

How do you know what Multiplayer will be?

I don't but Devs say theywill work on it after career
All of them!
ATM, Sandbox is much better than career. I just wish they would add the science reports to sandbox, instead of those dumb "this doesn't mean anything" reports. I don't even know why they did that.
Career mode for me. I seem to get bored in sandbox much more quickly than I would in career mode. Mods help with career mode as well.
Never even tried Career mode, and I can't see myself ever doing it.

I don't really decide between them; it depends on what I want to do.

Put a "Both" option in the poll please.

I play both. My tech tree is unlocked in career but I have a lot invested in it with bases and stations so I stick with it mostly.

My sandbox save is mostly to mess around with mods.
Multiplayer (Coop) Carreer Mode actually - together with some friends. That would be great.

Career mode, but I'd really like to see the science get some more depth. It feels too rigid and one-dimensional right now. My greatest fear is that the multiplayer will take over and there won't be any further improvements to science and the career mode.
career. because i like to start small and do science. even if i am already maxed out

Why not both?

Career for when I want to be more "realistic" and semi-RP.

Sandbox is for doing whatever I want.

Career is more "gamey"

Sandbox for testing things.

I had more arguments, but they kinda bailed my mind.

Development leaning towards career mode.

That's because sandbox mode is essentially complete. Because it doesn't need any science system, contracts, money, etc it doesn't require any dev time. What would the devs do to sandbox? Career mode still has a lot of stuff that has to be implemented.
I play sandbox. Career is for new players. I don't like the idea of rushing to sandbox, when I could just start in sandbox and go from there! Hopefully career will be

I'll go with career mode for the science.

If and when multiplayer does come along though I may set up a troll server just for shiggles.

Is KSP a game or a simulator?

If it's a game you need career, et al, so you can keep track of your score.

If it's a simulator then you just need all the sandbox options to simulate.

If it's both, they both have their place. If it's neither then I hope you're having fun anyway.
I play in sandbox all the time, since it allows me to make things more WhackJob-ish
Before I found Better Than Starting Manned, I only played sandbox and now I only play career.

I've never played career mode.

I do wish they would turn on science reports and points for sandbox mode, however, just to add to the fun there.

you can go into the game files for a career save and edit the science point cost of all the techs to 0
Sandbox, since I'm forever tinkering and prototyping.
